text: Hello. I am a grad student prescribed 10 MG Adderall. I've noticed it's dulled my personality out a bit and I seem to be extremely serious. Any treatment experiences for comorbid SAD or GAD

In case you couldn't guess, that title is dripping with sarcasm. I've had problems with depression my whole life, been hospitalized many times, destroyed my body with drugs and alcohol... and now, to top it all off, I'm about to get evicted from my apartment. Unfortunately for her, my girlfriend is sticking by me. I live in New Jersey, and it seems I'm stuck in this expensive ass state because my son, who lives with his mother, lives here and I'm catching hell from her for even contemplating leaving the state. I'm at the end of my rope and I'm not quite sure what to do. It's really like I'm in a state of limbo at the moment and I wish there was an answer for it all. I tried to off myself the other day by swallowing a bunch of pills, but to my dismay, all I did was throw everything up the next morning. What to do, what to do?

Drink water, unclench your jaw, and take a look at where you're at in your day.  


Cheers!

I'm 21 years old, was recently diagnosed with Bipolar I, and it was confirmed by a two more doctors I went to see for second opinions. I'm just recovering from a manic episode, I just learned what that is.

I was diagnosed with PTSD a few weeks ago, and this may have played a factor as this does not appear to be genetic.

Hello!  New to the sub, and new to Hashimoto's.  I was diagnosed yesterday.  **TSH: 4.69** (*range 0.4 - 4.1*), **FreeT4: 0.93** (*range 0.8 - 1.9*), **TPO: 430** (*range less than 9*).  I am still pending a thyroid ultrasound.  My close cousin has Hashimoto's, and my father and grandmother  (same side of family as cousin) struggled with thyroid issues before they passed.
I am going crazy and overthinking

So I just took my 5th dose of Entyvio last Thursday. I started it back in August. I had been having to use Rowasa daily to keep my UC in check. If I would stop them within two days bloody/mucousy stools would return. The doctor told me after this last infusion the Entyvio should definitely kick in. The night befor the infusion (Wednesday) was my last Rowasa and by Friday evening/ Saturday morning, the UC symptoms were back.

I've tried to talking to friends, and my significant other, but everyone is so busy with their own lives to even talk to me about it. And when they do have time, they just sit and stare at me without offering any type of support.

For ages before this while pandemic got serious in my country my ibs was manageable and I felt great. Since then I'm a mess. Stress is making my bowels go crazy, we have constipated for a few days and then bam liquid diarrhoea, the type you usually get after eating something bad. And the stomach cramps are horrendous! Currently having to take four imodium just to solve the issue and then rinse and repeat. I keep trying to let it run its course but the pain becomes too intense and I can't keep running up and down stairs to use the loo every 20 minutes with a grumpy 3 year old.

I wrote a suicide note on my blog a week ago before unsuccessfully trying to kill myself. A few friends of mine responded and acted concerned, one even asked how I was doing: but after that, the one who apparently wanted to know how I was faring wouldn't respond to my reply and everybody acted like it never happened. Nobody seems to care.

I try to help people with their pain and put this mask on to show them its okay, but if only they knew. Knew the pain I feel when I am alone. How I feel alone with people around me. I don't think I'll ever experience being in love because no one wants me anyway. They all like the idea of me, but not me... Everyone talks to me but no one wants me in their group. I'm drifting through this timeline waiting for a purpose and I can't see any. What's the point anymore? When I'm gone everyone will shocked for a moment only for me to be forgotten the next. I'm okay though, at least that's what I tell everyone. Why am I such a fucking liar?

Will topical fin with derma roller increase side effects ? Because it will increase blood flow which lead to more fin in the system.

Mods, delete if not allowed. This is probably a long shot, but I remember watching a documentary once where a girl had anorexia. The only thing I remember was that she had a feeding tube, and was showing the camera crew how she would do feeds but squeeze the paste out of the tube so it didn't go into her stomach. Does this sound familiar to anybody? I'm in the United States if that helps. I looked through the Intervention catalog and didn't see anything like it, but maybe it's from True Life or something? Any help would be great, it's been driving me crazy for ages.

I used to write to vent.  I'd write depressing things of people hurting each other, suicide, death, heartbreak.  All the things I could relate to.

I used to want to be an author, until I discovered I can't sit with a story idea long enough to do a novel.  Because I would never make it as a writer.  It was something I really enjoyed doing

I apologize if some of this seems almost conspiratorial, I'm just pissed at the healthcare system.

Sure, this disease is "curable" in most cases with meds and therapy, but reading around here about the suicide attempts makes me mad. Their solution is throw people into psych wards. I know it's for their own safety, but there's no follow up and no compassion. I'm wary of taking meds because I was on them for three years, when I got off I could actually *feel* again, for a bit. Seeing as I reacted somewhat well to the meds, I think I could possibly be a candidate for TMS. The thing is, you have to have trialed 4 types of SSRIs before you insurance will let you take it. It seems to be a permanent way of ridding yourself of depression, but it's out of reach for many people (and it might not work on all of them).

So last week a close friend of mine was found dead after being missing for a couple weeks. Presumed suicide, but without any witnesses its impossible to truely know. No note or goodbye to anyone, just gone. He was 22. 

After the funeral I decided to make some major  changes. I have left university (which I have unsuccessfully been trying to work on since my initial recovery from my diagnosis last year) and moved back to my home city to my parents to get a new start. I finally realised that I need to take my time to discover who I am and take care of myself.

I've started to hate myself so much that I don't want to go outside. Or when I do go out I become too paranoid and need to go home shortly after. Only time I can go out and feel OK is when I'm wearing a giant hoodie and cover my mouth with a scarf. I feel like I'm too awful of a person to be seen in public and I feel like everyone is staring at me thinking I am disgusting. I know it's probably not true but i can't shake the feeling when I'm actually out and about. Isolating myself isn't good but I don't have anyone who I trust who can help me to go out. I feel like the more I don't socialise the worse it will get but don't know where to start especially as I don't know many people.

I can’t remember anything. I can’t stay focused on anything. I try the 25 minutes focused, five minute break trick that usually helps. Currently I can barely focus for five minutes. My ADHD has never affected me this much.

(before I clean up the kitchen once a week and sand and dirt AL over the floor I didn't care) I'm very anxious for small things,  my mind is always busy and thinking and thinking too loud. I'm feeling out of control.  I'm feeling so much I was forgotten this part of me..

I’m having excruciating pain in my lower back near what seems to be my si joint. It’s been a recurring issue for years, but it flared up horribly within the past few days. Not to mention I was diagnosed with a torn peroneus brevis in my ankle a few days ago which isn’t helping. I’ve been resting and taking otc, but the pain is still unbearable. I have an appointment scheduled with an orthopedic doctor in 2 weeks, but I can’t wait that long for some relief. There is an orthopedic urgent care near me, but is it worth it? Will they be able to do an mri? I’m in agony from my butt to my ankle and idk what to do.

have a hard time knowing my true abilities due to this. I was always a very anxious and sensitive kid, and was “late” to do a lot of things (I had to go to summer school to learn how to read because I was behind, I was in middle school by the time I learned how to ride a bike, it took me a while to learn how to tie a shoe, etc) it was assumed to those around me that I had some sort of developmental delay but in hindsight I think my degree of stress and anxiety impacted my development (I was so nervous of getting into a bike accident that I had trouble trying to ride it)

I don't feel like going to work & once I get to work, I have no motivation to do anything. I don't know if I'm having a manic episode, but since I started taking the medicine I haven't felt the motivation to do anything in my life at all. Any similar experiences? How have others felt while in this dosage of medication?

Started July 1 on 75mg, started September 1 on 112.5 for anxiety, depression, OCD. 4th antidepressant I’ve been on because I get extreme fatigue from them. How the fuck do I deal with this fucking fatigue? Why won’t it just fucking go away? I just slept so good last night, 8.5 hours. And the second I open my eyes, I’m still exhausted. I can’t fucking take it. How have you dealt with/lessen/manage fatigue like this? I’m so tired of being fucking tired. Effexor is definitely helping my symptoms more than any med I’ve been on, but this fatigue- the ONLY side effect I have from antidepressants- is fucking debilitating, especially when you have things to do. I see people who are like “I’d rather be exhausted than anxious and depressed”, and that is AMAZING for them, but not for me. What have you done for the fatigue/exhaustion??

a discussion in NSCommunity reminded me of the Shame Wizard from Big Mouth and how helpful this (adult) cartoon has been in processing my grief/trauma as well experiencing joy and hope.

for those unfamiliar, Big Mouth is a USA cartoon centered on the experiences of year 7–9 students (middle schoolers), who are coping (humorously/tragically/inspiringly) with all things adolescent, but things that many adults are coping with, too <raises hand>

I was prescribed prazosin a few months ago for my nightmares and i wanna say it’s a total miracle drug for me when it comes to my nightmares. i used to wake up screaming 5-7x a week. i would actively try to avoid sleep. the one downside though is the dizziness. i drink plenty of water and try to eat a healthy diet and my job is very active so it’s not that im not taking care of myself, i’m just always dizzy. iv fainted a few times since taking it and working is becoming increasingly difficult. i just wonder does it get easier with time? is there anything i can do to help myself with the light headedness(certain foods or drinks)? this medication has helped me immensely and id hate to stop taking it

I do. I wash with the cleanser in the shower at night, do the stridex pads, then put the cold cream on as an overnight moisturizer. They have different textures (cleanser is thicker) but I have a feeling they pretty much do the same thing. My face feels clean but very moisturized after using then cleanser (it is hard to get all of your makeup off with it though. Use a wipe before) but I think the stridex dried me out a little so I use the regular cold cream to add it back in. I have very dry skin, though (esp. in the winter) so it might be too much if you're oily.

Get checked for diabetes. Despite being fit and healthy you could still have it and dry mouth plus the constant need to pee are warning signs.

Could potentially be Costochondritis which is inflammation of the cartilage that joins your ribs to your sternum. I had it a little while back and it felt like how you’ve described your pain.

Honestly it depends. Sleep paralysis doesn't automatically mean hallucinations. I've dealt with it since I was young. When I was younger I saw shadow figures. For two years I saw the old hag, consistently. But a good amount of time its just me staring at my ceiling completely paralyzed and trying to keep calm. There's no right or wrong way to have sleep paralysis.

Absolutely agree. I never once said it's easy to just add it in. A lot of people in denial that it is actually proven scientifically but it's understandable. There's also a presumption that I'm perfect with all of this, I can't even get most of it in properly, I'm pretty much miserable constantly but I'm not about to hold myself unaccountable for the things that I'm doing that are making it worse. Meaning and sleep are currently two things I have 0 control over as my body has robbed me of those, so I'm having to find new meaning and a way to get rest (medically struggle to sleep, not mentally but it's a major impact on my mental).

Depends on the game, really.

'Breath of the Wild' was amazing. I loved 'GTA V'.

On the other hand, while I loved playing 'Skyrim', it eventually exhausted me and I quit. I ended up with so many side-quests, and pursued them for so long that I lost the thread of the game a little and got bored. It turns out that the game will generate an infinite number of side-quests. Had I known that, I would have felt more comfortable ignoring a bunch of them, but I didn't, so the worry that I was going to miss something drove me to pursue every single one of them.

Your dopamine receptors are basically non existant on sustenna and basically your not rewarded by anything you do and the only reason your pursuing things is because you know your supposed to. I'm on Invega as well and I've become obese because when i eat there is no feeling satisfied. Not to mention the its a monthly injection that only becomes half effective after 40 something days so if you've been using the monthly injectable for years it will be years before you can be unaffected. I've been on it for years sleep nightly and i still hear voices all day and i live my life with earbuds in as a method of drowning out whats uncontrolled

My first thought is the same, but what if it happens to give adverse effects? I think that if I would be in critical conditions I would approve in principle that usage, but you never know.. what if you would have recovered without the drug?

What you need is an eye exam, by an optometrist.

artificial tears and medication like advil don't do anything against eye strain. 

Just get an eye exam, you'll probably need an Rx for glasses.

See, I know I can't experience one's trauma. But, I would like to be able to sympathize with them more. I've been through traumatic experiences before, mostly everyone has, and that's why I would think I could connect with how someone is feeling and understand all the uncomfortable feelings coming their way. But, sometimes I can't do that and it makes me feel selfish because I don't feel as sad for them as others do, even when I'm hearing about something really extreme like SA or the loss of a close friend to suicide or something like that. Of course I won't be able to feel what they're feeling completely, but I'd at least like to understand more. I still appreciate your comment, though and I hope you have a good day!

I'm on tretinoin 0.1%, so I got a sunscreen so that I don't burn my face off when I go outside since where I live has a high UV index. Every single sunscreen I have tried in my entire lifetime has not worked for me. The Biore one, Elta MD, Round Lab birch, Innisfree...none of them work. They all cause huge cystic acne spots on my normally clear skin.

every time i eat anything (even a bit of banana) i get a weird bloating/tight feeling in my abdomen, it reminds me of the feelings i used to get when i first started eating again after i lost a lot of weight and it was as if my body wasn't used to digesting, but then it passed but this week its come back even though i have barely eaten anything because of it, i have a lot of health anxiety too so although im terrified of it being something serious, im even more scared of talking to a doctor about it

With norovirus cases still high, I’ve been trying to just maintain my hand hygiene as much as I can. I also refuse to let this fear keep me from doing what I want to do. Today, my coworkers and I went to a small sandwich shop for lunch and then decided to eat in a park. At no point since we left the office did I have the opportunity to wash my hands, so I just sucked it up and ate the sandwich. Now I feel like for the next 48 hours I’m going to be thinking about whether I touched anything or if my phone could have norovirus particles on it. Genuine question: what is best practice when bathrooms aren’t around? Or does it just require a level of “risk” I don’t want to take right now?

2 weeks ago I (30f) fell off my bike and hit my chin on the ground. It bled a bit but the main problem was that there was a lot of swelling in the wound. It passed in a few days, there was almost no scar, but the bone under the wound was very swollen and formed a bump. That's why am asymmetry is now evident on my face. Will this bump stay forever or this is just swelling in the bone that will be gone after some time?

I get endo pain dreams but for whatever reason it's always bugs or worms burrowing under my skin where the pain is. I have no idea why my dreams always end with giant insect like things to terrify me lol
I can usually handle a few consecutive false awakenings as I detect them quickly.  It's when there are more than 5 in a row that things get confusing because I become amnesic to who I really am.

I felt a migraine starting last night so I want to lay down. Next thing I know it’s 6 o’clock in the morning and I wake up with a headache. About two hours later it turned into this migraine. I took my daily Qulipta and a couple hours later took her you Ubervly which is what my neurologist instructed me to do. The combination of those two drugs works wonders for my migraines. I just wish I would’ve found it six months sooner.

To me, this sounds a bit less direct than an alert, and more a general "you're stressing ME out!" from your pup. I would try to distract her from your anxiety with a feeder toy/kong/etc. The transition I WOULD follow to create a preferred alert behavior is to first; teach the alert behavior. I'll say... nose nudging. So, you'd teach that. Then when the dog barks, you'd ask them to nose nudge and reward the nose nudge.
